reference: Volume One, Issue Two, Phile 1 of 9
title: Phrack Inc. Index
historical_context: This is one of the early issues of Phrack, a prominent hacking zine that became a cornerstone of hacker culture in the late 20th century.
target_audience: Hackers, phreakers, and those interested in early computer security and hacking culture.
short_summary: This article serves as an index for the second issue of Phrack Inc., listing the articles included and their authors.
summary:
The 'Phrack Inc. Index' provides a comprehensive list of the articles featured in Volume One, Issue Two of the zine. Authored by Taran King, the index not only highlights the contributions of various writers but also sets the stage for the diverse topics covered in this issue. Readers can expect a mix of technical insights and cultural commentary that reflects the hacker ethos of the time.

The articles range from practical guides on preventing billing issues to explorations of homemade weaponry, showcasing the eclectic interests of the hacker community. This index serves as a roadmap for readers, allowing them to navigate the content effectively and select articles that pique their interest, whether they are looking for technical knowledge or cultural insights into the burgeoning world of hacking and phreaking.
